page.title: 15WAR PLANES & ARMY EXERCISES.
page.content: In common with many other South Shropshire areas we are regularly assaulted by the sudden, thunderous din of fast military aircraft practicing precision low level flying. Titterstone Clee hill, four miles away has a Civil Aviation Authority establishment and radar "mushrooms" on top. Brown Clee hill has several communications masts. It is common for small fleets of planes to run at these hills and manoeuvre low around the sky. U.S.A.F. A 10 fighters and R.A.F. Buccaneers, Phantoms and Tornadoes often appear. Occasionally Territorial Army exercises are held here too. It has been disconcerting to drive along and suddenly come face to face with prone soldiers manning heavy machine guns, the barrels pointing at one. {
